context/3: You see, Jennings, there are advantages to being on the sick list.
context/4: Murdering unarmed men?
context/6: Most of those men can't walk.
context/7: You can't call it a mass escape.
context/9: So has every man in the hospital.

context: Colonel, there's something rather odd going on.
response: I think we better have a look around before that train comes across.
context/1: River's gone down in the night.
context/3: As you once said, sir, I've got a lot to learn about the army.
context/4: Honestly, sometimes I don't understand you at all.
context/6: I'd rather not be a part of it.
context/7: It's hard to explain, sir.

context: You don't realise what a plum you are for us.
response: Your knowledge of the area, making friends in that village.
context/1: Well, feel like a sniff of air?
context/3: All right, Chapman, you can run along.
context/4: I'll pop over and check right away.
context/5: Arrange some practice jumps for him.
context/7: Well, maybe
context/8: Silly, it never occurred to me.

context: Mrs. Brenner?
response: Do you hear me, Mrs. Brenner?
context/0: Okay then, I'll be around for the money later this afternoon.
context/1: I know that.
context/2: And you won't stand a chance.
context/3: If I have to go into court, that cop will tell everything he heard today.
context/4: You really got yourself into trouble now.
context/5: I saw that one coming from way back.
context/6: I thought you had better sense.
context/7: That was a dirty trick you tried to pull before.

context: Not yet, Eduardo.
response: I need his help to organize my papers.
context/1: In two or three days.
context/4: Eduardo, why don't we leave the country and forget this.
context/7: That's not good news.
context/9: I'll aid you as soon as possible.

context: Thank you, Captain.
response: Well, what did you find?
context/1: Lieutenant.
context/4: Come in.
context/6: That old Chivington sure gonna be disappointed not to have somebody to shoot at.
context/7: Next time, obey the treaty.
context/8: In peace we return to our farms and women at Sand Creek.
context/9: To the south, we trade with our brothers.

context: # Passing the water, darling
response: # Pass the bucket down the line
context/0: # We've been working all day long
context/1: # We've been working all day long
context/2: # We've been working all day long
context/4: Fast.
context/6: You've got to use their momentum.
context/7: Get over there, Martin.
context/8: That's not the way I showed you.

context: Sergeant Hannah!
response: Sergeant Hannah!
context/1: Well, I hope his horse is good.
context/3: It's not good to have too many people know about a hoard of gold.
context/7: Oh, no.
context/8: I'm afraid I really must, old boy.

context: And still others we're furiously angry.
response: Hello CBS?
context/0: Is that what you call entertainment?
context/1: The whole house was in an uproar.
context/2: All the kids were screaming their heads off.
context/4: A fine trick the play on people.
context/7: Se how the others was takin' it.
context/8: Sure me and the old woman was runnin' down the streets, mingled with the crowds, but we wasn't scared ourselves, just for the kicks.
context/9: I knew it was a play all the time.

context: Taking charge of an estate before there was an estate.
response: Some people might think I was overzealous.
context/1: If he is, I've committed a crime or two.
context/4: For what?
context/7: That's just what I was thinking.
context/8: I think that concludes our business, officer.

context: So you have made no progress then?
response: Now, wait a minute, I didn't say that.
context/0: You can't expect us to nab the man instantly when he left no clues at all.
context/1: Now, see here, this only happened the night before last.
context/2: No, I'm afraid the public won't accept that in this case, Sergeant.
context/3: To report at an early date.
context/4: However, you may say that we expect to have something definite...
context/5: What we might know and what we're able to tell you are two different things.
context/6: You've made no progress so far.
context/7: So you better produce some results, eh, Sergeant.
context/9: I've been told to stick with this story till it's solved.
